info.description: Fast Healthcare Interoperability Resources (FHIR, pronounced "Fire") defines a set of "Resources" that represent granular clinical concepts. The resources can be managed in isolation, or aggregated into complex documents. Technically, FHIR is designed for the web; the resources are based on simple XML or JSON structures, with an http-based RESTful protocol where each resource has predictable URL. Where possible, open internet standards are used for data representation.
info.title: FHIR DiagnosticReport resource API documentation

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: Specify access token for API in the given format: Bearer [access_token].

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: The Accept request-header field can be used to specify certain media types which are acceptable for the response.

parameters.name: Resource data
parameters.description: The request body should be a valid data payload.

parameters.name: If-None-Exist
parameters.description: Specify the search query for conditional create.

400.description: DiagnosticReport could not be parsed or failed basic FHIR validation rules

422.description: The DiagnosticReport resource violated applicable FHIR profiles or server business rules.

post.description:
Create a new DiagnosticReport with a server assigned id.

FHIR documentation for DiagnosticReport.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: Specify access token for API in the given format: Bearer [access_token].

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: The Accept request-header field can be used to specify certain media types which are acceptable for the response.

parameters.name: Resource data
parameters.description: The request body should be a valid data payload.

parameters.name: _content
parameters.description: Search the contents of the resource's data using a fulltext search

parameters.name: _id
parameters.description: The resource identity

parameters.name: _language
parameters.description: The resource language

parameters.name: _lastUpdated
parameters.description: Only return resources which were last updated as specified by the given range. The date parameter format is yyyy-mm-ddThh:nn:ss(TZ). The prefixes >, >=, <= and < may be used on the parameter value.

parameters.name: _profile
parameters.description: Search for resources which have the given profile

parameters.name: _security
parameters.description: Search for resources which have the given security labels

parameters.name: _tag
parameters.description: Search for resources which have the given tag

parameters.name: _text
parameters.description: Search the contents of the resource's narrative using a fulltext search

parameters.name: category
parameters.description: Which diagnostic discipline/department created the report

parameters.name: code
parameters.description: The code for the report as a whole, as opposed to codes for the atomic results, which are the names on the observation resource referred to from the result

parameters.name: date
parameters.description: The clinically relevant time of the report. The date parameter format is yyyy-mm-ddThh:nn:ss(TZ). The prefixes >, >=, <= and < may be used on the parameter value.

parameters.name: diagnosis
parameters.description: A coded diagnosis on the report

parameters.name: encounter
parameters.description: The Encounter when the order was made

parameters.name: identifier
parameters.description: An identifier for the report

parameters.name: image
parameters.description: A reference to the image source.

parameters.name: issued
parameters.description: When the report was issued. The date parameter format is yyyy-mm-ddThh:nn:ss(TZ). The prefixes >, >=, <= and < may be used on the parameter value.

parameters.name: patient
parameters.description: The subject of the report if a patient

parameters.name: performer
parameters.description: Who was the source of the report (organization)

parameters.name: request
parameters.description: Reference to the test or procedure request.

parameters.name: result
parameters.description: Link to an atomic result (observation resource)

parameters.name: specimen
parameters.description: The specimen details

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: The status of the report

parameters.name: subject
parameters.description: The subject of the report

400.description: DiagnosticReport could not be parsed or failed basic FHIR validation rules (or multiple matches were found).

412.description: The given criteria is not selective enough.

put.description:
The conditional update interaction is used to update an existing DiagnosticReport based on some identification criteria, rather than by logical id.
